  19. module Raw = struct
  20.   (* Low-level primitives provided by the runtime *)
  21. ‌  type t = private int
  22.   external spawn : (unit -> unit) -> Mutex.t -> t
  23.     = "caml_domain_spawn"
  24.   external self : unit -> t
  25.     = "caml_ml_domain_id"
  26.   external cpu_relax : unit -> unit
  27.     = "caml_ml_domain_cpu_relax"
  28.   external get_recommended_domain_count: unit -> int
  29.     = "caml_recommended_domain_count" [@@noalloc]
  30. end

  32. ‌let cpu_relax () = Raw.cpu_relax ()

  34. ‌type id = Raw.t

  36. ‌type 'a state =
  37. | Running
  38. | Finished of ('a, exn) result

  40. ‌type 'a t = {
  41.   domain : Raw.t;
  42.   term_mutex: Mutex.t;
  43.   term_condition: Condition.t;
  44.   term_state: 'a state ref (* protected by [term_mutex] *)
  45. }

  47. module DLS = struct

  49. ‌  type dls_state = Obj.t array

  51. ‌  let unique_value = Obj.repr (ref 0)

  53.   external get_dls_state : unit -> dls_state = "%dls_get"

  55.   external set_dls_state : dls_state -> unit =
  56.     "caml_domain_dls_set" [@@noalloc]

  58. ‌  let create_dls () =
  59.     let st = Array.make 8 unique_value in
  60.     set_dls_state st

  62.   let _ = create_dls ()

  64. ‌  type 'a key = int * (unit -> 'a)

  66. ‌  let key_counter = Atomic.make 0

  68. ‌  type key_initializer =
  69.     KI: 'a key * ('a -> 'a) -> key_initializer

  71. ‌  let parent_keys = Atomic.make ([] : key_initializer list)

  73. ‌  let rec add_parent_key ki =
  74.     let l = Atomic.get parent_keys in
  75.     if not (Atomic.compare_and_set parent_keys l (ki :: l))
  76.     then add_parent_key ki

  78. ‌  let new_key ?split_from_parent init_orphan =
  79.     let idx = Atomic.fetch_and_add key_counter 1 in
  80.     let k = (idx, init_orphan) in
  81.     begin match split_from_parent with
  82.     | None -> ()
  83.     | Some split -> add_parent_key (KI(k, split))
  84.     end;
  85.     k

  87.   (* If necessary, grow the current domain's local state array such that [idx]
  88.    * is a valid index in the array. *)
  89. ‌  let maybe_grow idx =
  90.     let st = get_dls_state () in
  91.     let sz = Array.length st in
  92.     if idx < sz then st
  93.     else begin
  94.       let rec compute_new_size s =
  95.         if idx < s then s else compute_new_size (2 * s)
  96.       in
  97. ‌      let new_sz = compute_new_size sz in
  98. ‌      let new_st = Array.make new_sz unique_value in
  99.       Array.blit st 0 new_st 0 sz;
  100.       set_dls_state new_st;
  101.       new_st
  102.     end

  104. ‌  let set (idx, _init) x =
  105.     let st = maybe_grow idx in
  106.     (* [Sys.opaque_identity] ensures that flambda does not look at the type of
  107.      * [x], which may be a [float] and conclude that the [st] is a float array.
  108.      * We do not want OCaml's float array optimisation kicking in here. *)
  109.     st.(idx) <- Obj.repr (Sys.opaque_identity x)

  111. ‌  let get (idx, init) =
  112.     let st = maybe_grow idx in
  113.     let v = st.(idx) in
  114.     if v == unique_value then
  115.       let v' = Obj.repr (init ()) in
  116.       st.(idx) <- (Sys.opaque_identity v');
  117.       Obj.magic v'
  118.     else Obj.magic v

  120. ‌  let get_initial_keys () : (int * Obj.t) list =
  121.     List.map
  122.       (fun (KI ((idx, _) as k, split)) ->
  123.            (idx, Obj.repr (split (get k))))
  124.       (Atomic.get parent_keys)

  126.   let set_initial_keys (l: (int * Obj.t) list) =
  127.     List.iter
  128.       (fun (idx, v) ->
  129.         let st = maybe_grow idx in st.(idx) <- v)
  130.       l

  132. end

  134. (******** Identity **********)

  136. let get_id { domain; _ } = domain

  138. let self () = Raw.self ()

  140. let is_main_domain () = (self () :> int) = 0

  142. (******** Callbacks **********)

  144. (* first spawn, domain startup and at exit functionality *)
  145. let first_domain_spawned = Atomic.make false

  147. let first_spawn_function = ref (fun () -> ())

  149. let before_first_spawn f =
  150.   if Atomic.get first_domain_spawned then
  151.     raise (Invalid_argument "first domain already spawned")
  152.   else begin
  153.     let old_f = !first_spawn_function in
  154. ‌    let new_f () = old_f (); f () in
  155.     first_spawn_function := new_f
  156.   end

  158. ‌let do_before_first_spawn () =
  159.   if not (Atomic.get first_domain_spawned) then begin
  160.     Atomic.set first_domain_spawned true;
  161.     !first_spawn_function();
  162.     (* Release the old function *)
  163.     first_spawn_function := (fun () -> ())
  164.   end

  166. let at_exit_key = DLS.new_key (fun () -> (fun () -> ()))

  168. let at_exit f =
  169.   let old_exit : unit -> unit = DLS.get at_exit_key in
  170. ‌  let new_exit () =
  171.     (* The domain termination callbacks ([at_exit]) are run in
  172.        last-in-first-out (LIFO) order in order to be symmetric with the domain
  173.        creation callbacks ([at_each_spawn]) which run in first-in-fisrt-out
  174.        (FIFO) order. *)
  175.     f (); old_exit ()
  176.   in
  177.   DLS.set at_exit_key new_exit

  179. ‌let do_at_exit () =
  180.   let f : unit -> unit = DLS.get at_exit_key in
  181.   f ()

  183. let _ = Stdlib.do_domain_local_at_exit := do_at_exit

  185. (******* Creation and Termination ********)

  187. ‌let spawn f =
  188.   do_before_first_spawn ();
  189.   let pk = DLS.get_initial_keys () in

  191.   (* The [term_mutex] and [term_condition] are used to
  192.      synchronize with the joining domains *)
  193.   let term_mutex = Mutex.create () in
  194.   let term_condition = Condition.create () in
  195.   let term_state = ref Running in

  197.   let body () =
  198.     let result =
  199.       match
  200.         DLS.create_dls ();
  201.         DLS.set_initial_keys pk;
  202.         let res = f () in
  203.         res
  204.       with
  205.       | x -> Ok x
  206.       | exception ex -> Error ex
  207.     in

  209.     let result' =
  210.       (* Run the [at_exit] callbacks when the domain computation either
  211.          terminates normally or exceptionally. *)
  212.       match do_at_exit () with
  213.       | () -> result
  214.       | exception ex ->
  215.           begin match result with
  216.           | Ok _ ->
  217.               (* If the domain computation terminated normally, but the
  218.                  [at_exit] callbacks raised an exception, then return the
  219.                  exception. *)
  220.               Error ex
  221.           | Error _ ->
  222.               (* If both the domain computation and the [at_exit] callbacks
  223.                  raised exceptions, then ignore the exception from the
  224.                  [at_exit] callbacks and return the original exception. *)
  225.               result
  226.           end
  227.     in

  229.     (* Synchronize with joining domains *)
  230.     Mutex.lock term_mutex;
  231.     match !term_state with
  232.     | Running ->
  233.         term_state := Finished result';
  234.         Condition.broadcast term_condition;
  235.     | Finished _ ->
  236.         failwith "internal error: Am I already finished?"
  237.     (* [term_mutex] is unlocked in the runtime after the cleanup functions on
  238.        the C side are finished. *)
  239.   in
  240.   { domain = Raw.spawn body term_mutex;
  241.     term_mutex;
  242.     term_condition;
  243.     term_state }

  245. ‌let join { term_mutex; term_condition; term_state; _ } =
  246.   Mutex.lock term_mutex;
  247.   let rec loop () =
  248.     match !term_state with
  249.     | Running ->
  250.         Condition.wait term_condition term_mutex;
  251.         loop ()
  252.     | Finished res ->
  253.         Mutex.unlock term_mutex;
  254.         res
  255.   in
  256.   match loop () with
  257.   | Ok x -> x
  258.   | Error ex -> raise ex

  260. ‌let recommended_domain_count = Raw.get_recommended_domain_count
